title.narrative: Increase life-saving and resilience of the most vulnerable groups in northwest Syria through improved access to primary and specialized health service and a community-based resilience building

description.narrative: The project will build on previous achievements of the SCHF and continue to provide integrated supports (health and protection) to the vulnerable groups in an accessible way. The project complements other on-going HIHFAD projects funded by ECHO,and contribute to a broader coverage of comprehensive health/protection services such as PHCs network. Built on HIHFAD’s previous success in harnessing self-reliance among the most marginalized group as well as in promoting disability inclusive approach among the humanitarian organisations and the communities, the proposed project aims at increasing resilience of the persons with disabilities and IDPs through community and beneficiary participation. A PHC provides life-saving,critical health services to women,children,people with non-communicative diseases and elderly,in addition to essential LAB services,with transportation for referrals.Kalbeet PHC in Alamal Camps (the camp has been managed by TRC) and catchment area of other 12 camps.Services includes:women health–Children Health-elderly health through–the mentioned services are supported by Lab services and a pharmacy -also out reach activities will be through 4 CHWs. other services in the rounded communities ,Babl Alhawa Hospital is operated by SAMS,.Alameen PHC.For the near communities such as Atmeh and Dana HIHFAD is operating 2 general hospitals and one Maternity and children hospital. Albab physiotherapy centre offers comprehensive specialised health service including physiotherapy, PSS, orthopedic consultancies, peer supports, speech and hearing therapy and case management in order to ensure health access and to enhance protection of the persons with disabilities, transportation for people with disability.For COVID-19 HIHFAD developed an SOP related to this issue and shared it with the relevant technical working group (details uploaded as a document).Assistive devices and medical consumables will be provided to patients according to the needs identifiedby the qualified physiotherapists and case workers. Enhance participation of the persons with disabilities through the community inclusion networks and promotion of disability inclusion approach among non-protection actors/NGOs, such as Education, CCCM, WASH, FSL, ER. In addition to existing 14 community networks for disability inclusion, the project will add one more network, and all of them will further progress towards community-based rehabilitation (CBR) mechanism and act as ‘champions’ on disability inclusion via -Engage schools to build disability inclusion capacity at education facilities through peer supports and child resilience activities -Provide training and awareness sessions on inclusion of people with disabilities in communities -Identify and refer people with disabilities -Become an agent of advocacy in their communities for rights of people with disabilities -Plan and conduct community events of their choices -Conduct accessibility audits in selected camps/IDP sites/schools Address barriers to socio-economic opportunities and livelihood through customized supports of their choices for the persons with disabilities with case managements, apprenticeship programme and engagement of the private sector. -300 beneficiaries and their families among the most vulnerable households will benefit through case management, protection assistance, referrals, and access to socio-economic activities. -Engage the private sector on inclusive employment awareness raising and conduct barrier mapping) -Apprenticeship will offer training and working experiences with other organization on substituted salary while the beneficiaries can gain competitive working skills and knowledge.Upon the completion of apprenticeship, HIHFAD will promote inclusive employment among other humanitarian agencies, and it will advocate cooperating organisations to retain them. Evidences on supports for socio-economic opporounity are missing globally, particularly in northwest Syria.
